title: Brexit Backstop: what are the options Boris Johnson can turn to for the Irish border?
text:
There is renewed optimism at the prospect of a Brexit deal before October 31, after Jean-Claude Juncker, president of the European Commission, declared that he was willing to drop the backstop.

However, Mr Juncker was clear that any "alternative arrangements" had to allow "us and Britain to achieve the main objectives of the backstop. All of them".

If these alternative arrangements cannot be made to work, then a deal won't be found.

Yet the British Government has already spent nearly two years searching for suitable alternative arrangements for the Irish border – so what can Mr Johnson actually rustle up in under a month?
